definition: A layer which is composed of ground that 1) remains unfrozen due to increased solute concentration and 2) is present within a mass of permafrost.

label: rain
definition: An aggregate of raindrops falling to a planetary surface during a precipitation process.

label: water-based rain
subClassOf [LABEL]: some water raindrop| some water-based rainfall|rain
definition: Rain which is composed of water droplets falling to a planetary surface during a rainfall process.

label: protected area
subClassOf [LABEL]: fiat part of an astronomical object
definition: An environmental zone which 1) contains ecosystems, constructed features, or other entities deemed to be of natural, historical, cultural, or other significance and 2) has been afforded legal protections restricting one or more forms of use by a competent authority.

label: frost heave
definition: An elevation which is formed as an ice mass forms under soil, resulting in upwards deformation of the land surface.

label: sea surface layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: surface layer of a water body
definition: A surface layer which is part of an ocean or sea.

label: water current
definition: A hydroform which is maintained by a continuous, directed movement of water, generated by disequilibria in a water mass.

label: cryospheric layer
definition: A layer which is part of a cryosphere.

label: active layer in a cryosphere
definition: A layer of environmental material which is subject to freeze-thaw cycles.

label: thawing process
definition: A warming process during which the thermal energy in a portion of environmental material is sufficient to melt water-based ice or snow.

label: material warming process
definition: A process during which the temperature of a portion of environmental material is increased, along with the kinetic energy of its constituent molecules.

label: permafrost thawing process
definition: A thawing process during which permafrost is warmed beyond the melting point of water-based ice, snow, or other forms of solid water.

label: snow accumulation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some snow| some snow mass| some surface layer|material accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which the mass of snow on a surface increases.

label: ice accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which ice forms in an environmental material or an existing accumulation of ice increases in mass.

label: englacial
definition: A positional quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being located within a glacier or ice sheet, between their summer surface or bed.

label: glaciation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacial ice gain| some ice age
definition: An interval of time within an ice age and during which temperatures fall resulting in planet-wide glacier advances.

label: interglacial
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacial ice loss| some ice age
definition: An interval of time within an ice age and during which temperatures rise and result in planet-wide glacier retreat.

label: ice age
definition: A temporal interval during which a planet's surface and atmospheric temperatures fall, resulting in the presence or expansion of continental and polar ice sheets or alpine glaciers.

label: frost action process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some freezing of water into water ice|material transport process
definition: A material transport process during which alternate freezing and thawing of moisture in soil, rock and other materials results  modifications of those materials and in the formation of structures on, or in, the ground.

label: cryoturbation of soil
subClassOf [LABEL]: some soil| some soil cryoturbate|frost action process
definition: A frost action process during which soil is displaced.

label: soil cryoturbate
subClassOf [LABEL]: some cryoturbation of soil|solid astronomical body part
definition: A mass of soil moved or disturbed by frost action.

label: fluid surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of some liquid or gas.

label: lysocline
definition: A cline across which one or more solid environmental materials dissolve into their surrounding fluid.

label: nutricline
definition: A cline across which nutrient content of a fluid changes rapidly.

label: fluid interface layer
definition: A surface layer which separates two portions of fluid with respect to either 1) a discontinuity of some fluid property or 2) some derivative of one of these properties in a direction normal to the interface.

label: fluid layer
definition: A layer which is composed primarily of some fluid.

label: fluid front
definition: A fluid interface which separates two fluid masses with differing properties.

label: weather front
subClassOf [LABEL]: min 2 air mass| some atmospheric process
definition: A gaseous front which separates two masses of air with different densities and is a principal cause of meteorological phenomena.

label: air mass
definition: An object which is composed of a continuous mass of air.

label: interface layer
definition: A layer which separates two portions of environmental material which possess 1) differing compositions, 2) a discontinuity of some property, or 3) some derivative of some property in a direction normal to the interface.

label: mass of environmental material
definition: An object which is composed primarily of an environmental material

label: mass of solid material
definition: An mass of environmental material which is composed primarily of a solid environmental material

label: mass of fluid
definition: An object which is composed primarily of a fluid.

label: mass of liquid
definition: An object which is composed primarily of a liquid.

label: mass of compounded environmental materials
definition: An mass of environmental materials which has appreciable quantities of several individual materials, such that the removal of one would convert the mass into a different entity.

label: isohaline surface
definition: A material isosurface within which salinity is approximately constant.

label: isopycnal surface
definition: A material isosurface within which density is approximately constant.

label: isothermal surface
definition: A material isosurface within which temperature is approximately constant.

label: polar front
definition: A weather front which separates air masses of tropical and polar origin.

label: katabatic wind
definition: An atmospheric wind during which cold atmospheric gas flows downwards towards the surface of an astronomical body.

label: downslope katabatic wind
definition: A katabatic wind during which atmospheric gas flows down the slope of an elevation, typically during periods of light larger-scale winds.

label: drainage wind
definition: A downslope katabatic wind which is generated by the cooling of atmospheric gas in contact with terrain surfaces.

label: glacier wind
definition: A drainage wind which flows along the icy surface of a glacier.

label: mass fluid flow
subClassOf [LABEL]: some advective| some fluid environmental material|material transport process
definition: An advective transport process during which a fluid moves.

label: cyclonic circulation
definition: A mass fluid flow which moves  in the same direction as a planet's rotation, rotating due to a Coriolis effect.

label: subsurface zone of an astronomical body
definition: An environmental zone which includes those regions of an astronomical body which are not exposed to its atmosphere or space.

label: desert ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem in which the composition, structure, and function of resident ecological assemblages are primarily determined by a desert.

label: landmass
definition: A large continuous area of land, either surrounded by sea or contiguous with another landmass.

label: compound astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is composed of a continuous medium bearing liquid, gaseous, and solid material in variable quantities.

label: land
subClassOf [LABEL]: some solid environmental material|surface of an astronomical body
definition: A surface layer of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of solid material and is not covered by oceans or other bodies of water.

label: terrestrial ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which primarily occurs on land.

label: ecosystem process
definition: An environmental process either driven by or primarily impacting the parts or emergent properties of an ecosystem.

label: organic object
definition: An object which is formed as a result of one or more biological processes and is composed primarily of organic material.

label: rime
definition: Water ice which 1) has a white or milky and opaque appearance, 2) has a granular texture, and 3) is formed as a result of the deposition and rapid freezing of supercooled water drops as they make contact with an exposed object.

label: frost
subClassOf [LABEL]: some desublimation of water vapour into ice| some surface layer| some water ice crystal|environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is primarily composed of minute ice crystals forming a fuzzy layer over a cold surface by direct deposition of water vapor.

label: liquid accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which the volume of liquid entity increases.

label: surface landform
definition: A landform which occurs on the surface of an astronomical body.

label: landform
definition: A solid astronomical body part which has been formed from and is composed primarily of the matter of that astronomical body.

label: water-holding capacity
definition: A disposition of a material entity which is realised when it is saturated with liquid water.

label: particle
subClassOf [LABEL]: some particulate environmental material|mass of solid material
definition: A mass of solid material which is either 1) a minute fragment of a larger mass or 2) one of a collection of small masses composing an aggregate.

label: particle of clay
definition: A particle which 1) is composed primarily of hydrous aluminium phyllosilicate minerals, in turn composed of aluminium and silicon ions bonded into tiny, thin plates by interconnecting oxygen and hydroxide ions, and 2) is or was part of a portion of clay.

label: advective
definition: A physical quality of a process which is characteristic of process that transport material without, themselves, changing the qualities of those materials or the processes that are unfolding within them.

label: fiat part of an astronomical object
definition: A part of an environmental system whose boundaries are determined by fiat.

label: siliceous ooze
definition: Siliceous ooze is a marine sediment composed of the debris of plankton with silica shells, such as diatoms and radiolaria. This ooze is limited to areas with high biological productivity, such as the polar oceans, and upwelling zones near the equator. The least common type of sediment, it covers only 15% of the ocean floor. It accumulates at a slower rate than calcareous ooze: 0.2-1 cm / 1000 yr.

label: coastal water body
definition: Coastal water is a marine water body bordering a coast.

label: fluid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is unable to resist shear forces and continuously deforms when subject to them.

label: environmental system process
definition: A process in which includes the components of an environmental system as participants.

label: atmospheric process
definition: A process which occurs within an atmosphere.

label: greenhouse effect
definition: A process by which thermal radiation from a planetary surface is absorbed by atmospheric greenhouse gases, and is re-radiated in all directions. Since part of this re-radiation is back towards the surface and the lower atmosphere, it results in an elevation of the average surface temperature above what it would be in the absence of the gases.

label: ecosystem-wide photosynthesis
definition: A process which consists of all photosynthesis processes instantiated in an ecosystem.

label: ecosystem-wide respiration
definition: A process which consists of all respiration processes instantiated in an ecosystem.

label: biogeochemical cycling
definition: A biogeochemical process during which one or more chemical compounds are sequentially converted into a series of related compounds in a regularly repeating, periodic fashion.

label: carbon cycling
definition: A biogeochemical cycle which has carbon-bearing chemical entities as participants.

label: algal bloom process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some algal bloom| some aquatic environment|ecosystem process
definition: A process during which the populations in a community of algae in a marine or freshwater ecosystem undergo rapid growth, resulting in high concentrations of algal cells that occur only periodically and briefly in that ecosystem, relative to their concentrations through the majority of the planetary orbital period.

label: anthropogenic environmental process
definition: An environmental process which is driven by the action of humans.

label: planetary erosion
subClassOf [LABEL]: some environmental material| some planetary crust|erosion
definition: An action of exogenic processes (such as water flow or wind) which remove environmental material from one part of a planet's crust, transporting it to another location where it is deposited.

label: biogeochemical process
definition: A process during which chemicals that are involved in natural ecosystem processes are transported or transformed, and which impact the activity of biological entities

label: environmental pollution
definition: An environmental system process that results in the introduction of contaminants into an environment.

label: air pollution
definition: A pollution process during which particulates or other contaminants are released into a portion of air.

label: soil pollution
definition: A pollution process during which contaminants are released into soil.

label: water pollution
definition: A pollution process during which contaminants are released into water.

label: plastic pollution
definition: A pollution process during which plastic contaminants are released into an environmental material.

label: pollution monitoring
definition: A monitoring process that assays the level of environmental pollutants to determine the presence of effect of environmental pollution.

label: neve
definition: Partially compacted granular snow, which has undergone several cycles of melting and refreezing while being compacted, usually found on the atmosphere-exposed surface of a glacier.

label: firn
definition: Granular snow which contains a proportion of fused granules formed through melting and re-thawing while being compacted by the weight of overlying material and which contains interconnected gaseous pores.

label: nivation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some compaction process| some powdery snow| some snowfall|material transformation process
definition: A material transformation process during which recently precipitated, powdery snow transitions into firn or névé through compaction and/or through cycles of freezing and thawing.

label: glacial ice
definition: Any water ice that is part of a glacier.

label: erosionally enriched glacial ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacial erosion process| some glacier|erosionally enriched ice
definition: Glacial ice which contains material liberated during a glacial erosion process.

label: glacial erosion process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacier| some planetary landmass|planetary erosion
definition: An erosion process during which the movement of a glacier across a terrestrial surface causes the removal of material from that surface.

label: blue ice
definition: Water ice containing little to no air bubbles resulting in a reduction of internal light scattering and, given sufficient volume, a blue appearance.

label: compaction process
definition: A physical process during which atoms, molecules, or other consituents of a material entity are forced closer together.

label: material accumulation process
definition: A process during which the mass of one or more materials, present within a given site, increases.

label: material transport process
definition: A process during which material is displaced from its original location and transported either to a new location or back to the original location.

label: ice gain
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice mass| some water ice|ice accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which the mass of an existing ice mass increases.

label: glacial transport process
definition: A material transport process during which the snow and ice constituting a glacier, and anything contained within it, is transported down a slope by gravitation.

label: cirque glacier
definition: A small glacier contained within a cirque basin.

label: geographic basin
definition: A depression which is part of a planetary crust, is of geographic scale, and is partially or completely enclosed.

label: material decumulation process
definition: A process during which a mass composed of one or more environmental materials, present within a given site, decreases.

label: glacial ice loss
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacial ice| some glacier|ice loss process
definition: A process during which the mass of ice constituting a glacier decreases.

label: englacial stream
definition: A stream which is primarily composed of meltwater and which flows within a glacier or ice sheet.

label: aeolian transport process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some atmospheric wind| some environmental material|material transport process
definition: A material transport process during which one or more environmental materials are transported by the action of wind.

label: soot
definition: Particulate environmental material which is composed primarily of carbon particles formed through the incomplete combustion of hydrocarbons.

label: erosionally enriched ice
definition: Water ice which contains material liberated during an erosion process.

label: powdery snow
definition: Uncompacted snow containing trapped atmospheric gases.

label: glacial ice gain
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacial ice| some glacier|ice gain
definition: A process during which the mass of ice constituting a glacier increases.

label: glacial ice calving process
definition: A process during which a part of a glacier breaks away from the main mass.

label: iceberg calving process
definition: A process during which a part of a glacier breaks away from the main mass as an iceberg.

label: calving of ice from an iceberg
definition: A process during which a part of an iceberg breaks away from the main mass.

label: marine sediment
subClassOf [LABEL]: some marine water body| some sedimentation in a water body|sediment
definition: Sediment which has been transported through the marine water column, settling on the seafloor.

label: shallow marine sediment
definition: Marine sediment soured from either terrestrial systems, marine organisms, seawater and or cosmogeneous sources, which is transported through the marine water column, and accumulates within shallow regions of the oceanic basin close to continents, such as the continental shelf, or continental slope.

label: supraglacial lake
definition: A water body which is located in a depression within the surface of a glacier.

label: sedimentation in a water body
subClassOf [LABEL]: some material transport process| some particulate environmental material| some precipitation process| some water body|material accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which solid particles are pulled through a water body by gravitation or centrifugal force and which ends when they settle on a solid surface.

label: glacial ice ablation zone
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacial ice ablation process| some glacier|ice ablation zone
SYNONYMS: area of glacial ablation|glacial ablation area|glacial ice ablation area
definition: An ablation zone which is part of a glacier.

label: cryoconite deposit
subClassOf [LABEL]: some aeolian transport process| some dust| some rock| some soot|particulate environmental material
definition: Particulate environmental material which is composed primarily of dust, rock, and soot, as well as the microbial communities associated with these materials, deposited on an ice mass by an aeolian process.

label: cryoconite hole
definition: A vertical thaw hole within an ice mass, formed as a result of ice melt associated with local temperature increases, due to increased absorption of solar radiation by cryoconite deposits.

label: melt pond
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice mass| some icemelt| some meltwater|water body
definition: A water body which forms as a result of localised melting taking place on the surface of a glacier or a mass of sea ice and which is contained in the cavity formed by such melting.

label: brine channel
subClassOf [LABEL]: some brine| some brine channel formation process| some water ice|channel
definition: A channel through which brine flows.

label: brine channel formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some brine| some brine channel| some brine rejection from seawater| some water ice|material accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which brine droplets, trapped between ice crystals formed during seawater freezing, form brine channels.

label: material transformation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some environmental material| some environmental material|environmental system process
definition: A process during which a portion of some environmental material is converted into a different material or a collection of materials.

label: sea ice formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some sea ice| some sea water|water ice formation process
definition: A material transformation process during which seawater freezes into sea ice.

label: brine rejection from seawater
subClassOf [LABEL]: some brine| some sea ice formation process| some sea water|material transformation process
definition: A material transformation process during which brine is formed due to the expulsion of salt during frazil formation or a seawater freezing process.

label: frazil ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some frazil|new ice|partially_surrounded_by some liquid water
definition: New ice which is composed frazil which has congealed into a thin sheet.

label: frazil ice formation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some frazil ice| some liquid water|new ice formation process
definition: A new ice formation process during which small, needle-like crystals consisting of nearly pure fresh water, form due to the freezing of open, turbulent, supercooled water.

label: thaw hole
definition: A channel which traverses an ice mass floating on a water body and bridges the atmosphere to the underlying water through its internal cavity.

label: atmosphere-exposed melt pond
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice mass| some melting| some meltwater| some troposphere|melt pond
definition: A melt pond which has a surface exposed to the atmosphere.

label: ice-encased melt pond
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice mass| some melting| some meltwater|melt pond|surrounded by some water ice
definition: A melt pond which is completely encased in ice and thus not directly exposed to the atmosphere or underlying water.

label: intraglacial lake
definition: A lake which is comprised of meltwater located underneath or within a glacier.

label: depositional process
definition: A process during which material entities are added to a landform or to a feature upon the landform.

label: desublimation of water vapour into ice
definition: A desublimation process during which water vapour is frozen into water ice.

label: new ice formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some liquid water|water ice formation process
definition: An ice formation process during which water is frozen into a form of new ice such as frazil, grease ice, slush, or shuga.

label: obsolete sea ice formation process
definition: An ice formation process during which seawater is frozen into a sea ice.

label: nilas formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some new ice| some nilas|sea ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which new ice crystals freeze together, forming nilas, a thin, elastic, continuous, ice sheet of a transparent gray color.

label: young ice formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some young ice|sea ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which water freezes to the bottom of an existing nilas ice floe creating a thicker ice floe known as young ice.

label: first year ice formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some first year ice|sea ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which seawater freezes onto young ice during the cold season, forming first year ice.

label: second year ice formation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some second year ice|sea ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which seawater freezes onto first year ice during the cold season, forming second year sea ice.

label: multiyear ice formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some multiyear ice|sea ice formation process
definition: A sea ice formation process during which seawater freezes into second year ice during the cold season, forming multiyear ice.

label: new ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some new ice formation process| some water body|water ice
definition: Water ice which is formed from freezing water and is suspended in a water body.

label: ice floe
subClassOf [LABEL]: some water body| some water ice|ice mass
definition: An ice mass which forms a cohesive and contiguous sheet of water ice, floating upon the surface of a water body.

label: sea ice floe
subClassOf [LABEL]: some marine water body| some sea ice formation process| some water ice|ice floe
definition: An ice floe which is formed from frozen sea water, and floats upon the surface of a marine water body.

label: pancake ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some marine water body| some sea ice formation process| some water ice|sea ice floe
definition: A sea ice floe which has a rounded or circular shape and raised rims.

label: nilas
subClassOf [LABEL]: some marine water body| some nilas formation process| some water ice|sea ice floe
definition: A sea ice floe which is thin, elastic, continuous, and of a transparent gray color, which results from the freezing of new ice.

label: young ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some marine water body| some water ice| some young ice formation process|sea ice floe
definition: A sea ice floe which is inflexible and thicker than nilas.

label: first year ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some first year ice formation process| some young ice|sea ice
definition: Sea ice which has formed over a single freezing season.

label: second year ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some second year ice formation|sea ice
definition: Sea ice which is thicker than first year ice, and has survived a seasonal melting process.

label: multiyear ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: some multiyear ice formation process|sea ice
definition: Sea ice which is thicker than second year ice, and has survived more than two seasonal melting process.

label: grease ice layer
definition: A layer which consists of a thin aggregate of frazil ice crystals, which float upon the surface of a water body.

label: shuga
definition: New ice, which is spongy, lumpy and opaque, and forms from water which freezes in an agitated water body.

label: slush ice
definition: A slurry of frazil, snow, and liquid water.

label: slush ice layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: some slush ice| some water body|water ice layer
definition: A layer which consists of slush ice.

label: slush formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some slush ice|new ice formation process
definition: A new ice formation process in which slush ice is formed.

label: shuga formation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some liquid water| some shuga|new ice formation process
definition: A new ice formation process in which shuga is formed.

label: thermokarst lake
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice-bearing permafrost thawing process| some meltwater| some thermokarst| some thermokarst depression|freshwater lake
definition: A freshwater lake which fills a depression formed by the erosion of thermokarst caused by permafrost thaw.

label: methane-releasing thermokarst lake
subClassOf [LABEL]: some atmosphere| some methane gas emission process|thermokarst lake
definition: A thermokarst lake through which methane gas released from thawing permafrost, or other methane stores, rises and escapes to the atmosphere.

label: thermokarst depression
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice-bearing permafrost thawing process| some thermokarst|geographic basin
definition: A geographic basin which is formed due to the erosion of thermokarst by meltwater released from thawing permafrost.

label: thermokarst
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice-bearing permafrost thawing process| some thermokarst depression|planetary landmass
definition: An irregular land surface which consists of marshy hollows, hummocks, thermokarst depressions and thermokarst lakes formed from the erosion of ice-rich thawing permafrost areas.

label: ice-bearing permafrost thawing process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some hydrological melting process| some meltwater| some methane gas emission process|permafrost thawing process
definition: A permafrost thawing process during which water-based ice or snow present in permafrost is converted into meltwater.

label: methane-laden permafrost
definition: Permafrost which contains pockets of trapped methane gas.

label: permafrost crater derived from a methane explosion
definition: A crater which is found in permafrost and formed as a result of an explosion fuelled by methane formerly contained in that permafrost.

label: explosion process
definition: A process during which a material entity undergoes a rapid increase in volume, releasing gasses and various forms of energy, often including thermal, light and sound energy.

label: permafrost methane explosion
definition: An explosion during which methane-rich gas trapped in permafrost combusts.

label: gas emission process
definition: A material transport process during which a portion of gaseous environmental material is transported into the atmosphere.

label: hydrocarbon gas emission process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some greenhouse effect| some hydrocarbon gas|gas emission process
definition: A gas emission process during which a portion of hydrocarbon gas is transported into the atmosphere.

label: methane gas emission process
definition: A hydrocarbon gas emission process during which a portion of methane gas is transported into the atmosphere.

label: season generating process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some planet| some season| some star|environmental system process
definition: A process during which the intesity of stellar radiation received by a planet's surface varies in a cyclical regime due to the planet's orbital motion around the barycentre of a planetary system and/or the tilt of its rotational axis relative to its orbital plane.

label: season
definition: A one-dimensional temporal region which is delimited by the occurrence of processes which serve as its delimiters.

label: warm season
definition: A season during which the average temperature of a planetary part exceeds that of all other seasons it endures during a season generating process.

label: cold season
definition: A season during which the average temperature of a planetary part is below that of all other seasons it endures during a season generating process.

label: seasonal melting process
definition: A material transformation process during which a material entity melts during a warm season.

label: solid-phase sintering
definition: A compaction process during which a material entity subjected to heat and/or pressure is compacted into a solid mass without undergoing melting.

label: glacial sintering
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacial ice| some snow|solid-phase sintering
definition: A sintering process during which snow is compacted into glacial ice.

label: aeolian transport of snow
subClassOf [LABEL]: some environmental material| some powdery snow|aeolian transport process
definition: An aeolian transport process during which powdery snow is displaced and moved.

label: snow drift formation
subClassOf [LABEL]: some aeolian transport of snow| some powdery snow|snow accumulation process
definition: An accumulation process during which a powdery snow carried on the wind settles on a solid surface, forming a mound.

label: slab avalanche
definition: A mass wasting process during which slab snow rapidly moves down a sloping surface.

label: powdery snow avalanche
definition: An avalanche during which powdery snow rapidly flows down a sloping surface.

label: wet snow avalanche
definition: An avalanche during which a suspension of water and snow flows down a sloping surface.

label: slab snow
definition: Snow which is cohesive, hard and overlies weaker snow.

label: cryoform
definition: A solid astronomical body part which is primarily composed of a continuous mass of snow and/or ice.

label: snow mass
definition: A mass of snow.

label: snow drift
subClassOf [LABEL]: some powdery snow| some snow drift formation|snow mass
definition: An accumulation of powdery snow which was transported and deposited via a snow drifting process.

label: snow patch
subClassOf [LABEL]: some cold season| some planetary landmass|snow mass
definition: An accumulation of snow and firn which rests upon land.

label: seasonal snow patch
subClassOf [LABEL]: some cold season| some planetary landmass| some seasonal melting process|snow patch
definition: A snow patch which forms during a cold season and melts away during the succeeding warm season.

label: perennial snow patch
subClassOf [LABEL]: some cold season| some planetary landmass| some seasonal melting process|snow patch
definition: A snow patch which persists through at least one seasonal cycle.

label: snowpack
subClassOf [LABEL]: some compaction process| some snow|snow mass
definition: A snow mass which is large enough, and persists long enough, to undergo compaction under its own weight, leading to layer-like structural differentiation.

label: channel
definition: A structure which traverses a mass of one or more environmental materials, and encloses a roughly tubular site.

label: atmosphere and water column exposed melt pond
definition: A melt pond which and is exposed to the atmosphere and to a lesser degree water underlying the ice mass which contains it.

label: water column exposed melt pond
definition: A melt pond which is formed close to that part of an ice mass which is in contact with some underlying water body, and which has channels connecting it to that water body.

label: subglacial lake
subClassOf [LABEL]: some glacier| some planetary landmass|ice-covered lake
definition: A lake which is situated beneath a glacier.

label: erosion through nivation
definition: An erosion process during which rock or soil is removed or degraded due to alternative thawing and freezing of meltwater beneath and at the margins of snowbanks.

label: WMO blizzard
definition: A blizzard which 1) lasts at least 3 hours, 2) combines below freezing temperatures and very strong wind, laden with blowing snow.

label: NSIDC blizzard
definition: A blizzard which has 1) winds of 35 miles per hour (approximately 56 kilometers per hour), 2) lasts for a period of at least three hours, and 3) occurs in extremely cold temperatures.

label: winter blizzard
definition: A blizzard which occurs in winter.

label: freezing fog
definition: A fog the droplets of which freeze upon contact with exposed objects, forming a coating of rime or glaze.

label: particle of snow
subClassOf [LABEL]: some freezing of water into water ice| some water ice|particle
SYNONYMS: grain of snow|granular snow|granule of snow|snow grain|snow granule|snow particle
definition: A particle which is 1) primarily compposed of water ice, 2) on the order of 1 milimeter or less, 3) has a white and opaque appearance, and 4) is formed as a result of water droplets freezing during precipitation.

label: ice fog
SYNONYMS: air hoar|frost flakes|frost fog|frozen fog|ice-crystal fog|pogonip|rime fog
definition: Fog which is composed of particles of ice.

label: tundra climate
definition: A climate which 1) has a mean temperature for the warmest month of less than 10°C (50°F), but higher than 0°C (32°F), 2) is not conducive to a permanent surficial cover of snow or ice, and 3) supports a tundra ecosystem.

label: snow layer
definition: A cryospheric layer which is primarily composed of snow.

label: snow water equivalent
definition: A depth which inheres in a layer of liquid water derived from the complete melting a mass of snow contained in an area.

label: cryosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed primarily of environmental materials in their frozen form.

label: planetary cryosphere
definition: A cryosphere which is part of a planet.

label: snow-covered land
SYNONYMS: area of snow cover|land covered by snow|snow covered land
definition: Land which is covered or partially covered by snow.

label: area of alpine tundra
definition: An area of tundra which is present in a region subject to alpine conditions.

label: snow cover
definition: An area density which inheres in snow distributed over an area of a landmass or other substrate.

label: heavy snowfall
definition: Snowfall which has an increased rate.

label: ice pellet
definition: An ice mass which is 1) transparent or translucent, 2) rounded, spherically, or cylindrically shaped, and 3) less than 5 milimetres in diameter.

label: lake-effect snowfall
subClassOf [LABEL]: some lake| some material warming process|snowfall
definition: Snowfall which 1) is localized, 2) is convective, and 3) occurs as a result of a cold, dry air mass absorbing heat and moisture as it flows over a lake with warmer waters.

label: lake-effect snow storm
definition: A snowstorm during which intense lake-effect snowfall occurs.

label: lambing storm
definition: A snowfall which occurs during springtime and is of low intensity.

label: falling sleet
subClassOf [LABEL]: some sleet pellet| some water droplet| some water ice crystal
definition: An object aggregate which is primarily composed of particles of water in liquid, frozen, or partially frozen states.

label: freezing rain
definition: Water-based rain which is composed of supercooled water droplets, which freeze on contact with surfaces.

label: hail
definition: Precipitation which is composed primarily of hail stones.

label: hail stone
definition: An ice mass which 1) occurs in a ball-shape or irregular lump, 2) has a minimum diameter of 5 millimeters (or 0.2 inches), and 3) is formed within convective clouds.

label: falling snow
definition: An object aggregate which is composed primarily of snow falling through an atmosphere.

label: precipitation of sleet
definition: A hydrological precipitation process during which water falls in both liquid and frozen form.

label: sleet pellet
definition: An ice mass which is primarily composed of frozen or mostly frozen raindrops or refrozen partially melted snowflakes.

label: area of ice cover
subClassOf [LABEL]: some ice surface layer|fiat part of an astronomical object
definition: An environmental zone which is covered or partially covered by ice.

label: depth of water ice
definition: The depth of some water ice.

label: adfreezing
definition: Adfreezing is a freezing process during which two objects adhere to each other via ice.

label: frost heaving process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some freezing of water into water ice| some planetary surface|cryoturbation of soil
definition: Frost heaving is a process during which an upwards swelling of soil occurs due to freezing conditions caused by an increasing presence of ice as it grows towards the surface.

label: active permafrost layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: some permafrost| some permafrost thawing process|active layer in a cryosphere
definition: A layer which is composed of ground that is 1) subject to annual thawing and freezing and 2) present in areas underlain by permafrost.

label: plastic
definition: An environnmental material which 1) is composed primarily of polymers with high molecular mass and 2) once deformed does not spontaneously return to its original shape.

label: synthetic plastic
definition: A plastic which is composed primarily of polymers produced by a manufacturing process.

label: compacted soil
definition: A soil which has a high bulk density and/or a low porosity. A compacted soil has a reduced rate of both water infiltration and drainage

label: water-holding capacity of soil
definition: Water-holding capacity which inheres in some soil.

label: depth of snow
definition: The depth of some snow.

label: hours of sunshine
definition: A one-dimensional temporal region during which an entity is exposed to stellar radiation.

label: algal bloom
definition: A feature that arises from a rapid increase or accumulation in the population of algae (typically microscopic) in an aquatic system.

label: freshwater algal bloom
definition: An algal bloom that is located in freshwater. Freshwater algal blooms are the result of an excess of nutrients, particularly some phosphates.
